purpose.summary: This DBDGEN source file defines the IMS database PASFLDBD with GSAM and BSAM access methods and no password protection. It specifies a single dataset group DSG001 containing two fixed-block datasets (RECFM=F, LRECL=100): PASFILIP as input (DD1) and PASFILOP as output (DD2). The definition was assembled with IMS version 15.1 on 04/21/2023.
purpose.business_context: IMS database definition for PASFL-related input/output file processing

inputs.name: PASFILIP
inputs.description: Input dataset (DD1) in dataset group DSG001 for the PASFLDBD GSAM database, with fixed-length records of 100 bytes

outputs.name: PASFILOP
outputs.description: Output dataset (DD2) in dataset group DSG001 for the PASFLDBD GSAM database, with fixed-length records of 100 bytes

open_questions.question: What does 'PASFL' acronym represent?
open_questions.context: Not specified in the DBD source; likely application-specific (e.g., Passenger Flight Load?)
open_questions.suggestion: Check related PSB, COBOL programs, or system documentation

open_questions.question: Are there associated segment or field definitions?
open_questions.context: No segments or PCB defined in this GSAM DBD; only dataset group specified
open_questions.suggestion: Review linked PSBGEN or application programs using this DBD
